_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:16:16 using v2.1
title: How do employment rates for people with LTCs vary by age?
analysis_commentary: The disparity in employment rates between people with LTCs and the general population is lowest in the younger age group (difference of 5.6% in 16-19 year olds) and oldest (difference of 8.8% in those aged 60 and over) age groups. Between these ages, the difference ranges from 11.3% to 14.9%. However, the gap in employment rates for younger people has widened since 2007 (when the gap for 16-19 year olds was just 4.4%) whereas it has narrowed for all groups aged over 20 - most notably for those 45-49, which was 16.9% in 2007 and 14.9% in 2013.
